intro: Cyrtochilum klabochii, commonly known as the Klaboch's orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces dark purple or violet blooms with yellow markings, which are often borne on erect, hairy stems. Cyrtochilum klabochii prefers shaded, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or wooded areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
